intro: Lagascea aurea, commonly known as golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Lagascea aurea is also noted for its medicinal properties, though it can be toxic if ingested in large quantities.
